bibl.title: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Estela Agramonte Rodriguez Leon, October 17, 1941

div1.p: Hench is disappointed that the missing data did not turn up in her father's papers, and plans to visit the Agramonte Memorial Library, in New Orleans, to examine Agramonte's materials there.

div1.head: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Estela Agramonte Rodriguez Leon, October 17, 1941
div1.p:
By separate post I am sending you a copy of the current issue
of Hygeia with my article on yellow fever. I will soon have reprints
available and will gladly send you as many as you wish. Please let me
know. I did appreciate your letter. I am so disappointed to know that
your search in the trunk didn't reveal the missing data. I am still
hoping it will turn up and I certainly will visit Havana again.

This letter is hastily written as I am leaving to speak
at a medical meeting in Florida. I will be back home in a week however
at which time the reprints should be here.

Please accept my kindest regards for yourself and your
husband.

closer.seg:
P. S. I have just gone over some of our past correspondence
and find your early statement that many of your father's papers, books,
etc. are in the Agramonte Memorial Library of the Louisiana State Medical
Center. Surely that is in New Orleans, isn't it? I note that New Orleans
is close to Pensacola, hence I now plan to return home via New Orleans
so as to visit the library.
P.S.H.
(Letter written 10-14-41)
